message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of storms. When there is a storm, the running and moving liquid fluid (rain) can cause weather damage. This can include strong winds, heavy rain, lightning, and flooding, which can all cause damage to buildings, infrastructure, and the environment. Option (A) is incorrect because insects are not directly caused by the running and moving liquid fluid during a storm. Option (C) is unrelated to storms and more related to friction. Option (D) is unrelated as lava is not typically associated with storms.
